entry.title: calc-size built expression gets computed to `calc(10px)` instead of `10px`.
entry.content:
calc-size built expression gets computed to `calc(10px)` instead of `10px`.
third_party/blink/web_tests/external/wpt/html/semantics/permission-element/bounded-sizes.tentative.html exemplifies this behavior for the <permission> element which has custom logic to build max/min widths.

entry.title: Crash when long pressing Tab in Grid on selection mode
entry.content:
iPad only
1. Open the TabGrid 2. Tap on "Edit > Select Tabs" 3. Long press on a tab

entry.title: [css-anchor-position] No invalidation if fallback matches base style
Mobile preset will not render correct placement of select box
entry.content:
Chrome Version : <from chrome://123.0.6312.106/> OS : MacOS 14.4.1
What steps will reproduce the problem? If you inspect a website using a select element from chakra ui and go into mobile view and select iPhone 12 Pro, it will render the mobile selection box in the wrong place. It will not happen when you use responsive mode and enter the exact same display size (nor does it happen on non-chromium browsers).
What is the expected result? The selection box is rendered above or underneath or in the same place as the select element.
What happens instead? The selection box is rendered in a different place.
See Screenshot for clarification!

entry.title: emSign Singal-Purpose Roots for EV trust emSign
entry.content:
Hi,
Please find the below request for inclusion in the hard-coded list in the binary of which root certificates are "EV-Qualified".
1. Name of CA: emSign Root TLS CA - G1 • Certificate: https://repository.emsign.com/certs/roottlscag1.crt • Fingerprint of EV root: CE:F7:1E:70:B7:C2:9A:DD:F6:C3:0C:D1:9E:61:4B:38:FD:5F:02:A4:35:A0:EE:DD:D0:08:7E:18:3D:10:1A:51 • OID uses to issue EV certs: 2.23.140.1.1 • The root generation process was overseen by a WebTrust auditor, and the audit report is accessible at https://repository.emsign.com/downloads/auditreports/emSignRootKGC2024.pdf.
2. Name of CA: emSign Root TLS CA - G3 • Certificate: https://repository.emsign.com/certs/roottlscag3.crt • Fingerprint of EV root: 7D:D7:8D:5F:4F:13:45:9A:83:DF:F9:AB:BB:A6:2E:DB:AF:6F:2D:10:2B:F2:57:FD:71:2F:4D:9F:27:46:ED:8D • OID uses to issue EV certs: 2.23.140.1.1 • The root generation process was overseen by a WebTrust auditor, and the audit report is accessible at https://repository.emsign.com/downloads/auditreports/emSignRootKGC2024.pdf.
Thanks, Naveen.

entry.title: Scrolling performance declined in memory heavy web application
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem There are no generic reproduction steps here, as it's a performance issue that affects a rather complex platform.
# Problem Description We run a rather heavy analytics platform in angular. Our customers reported a decline in performance during the last week(s). The issue happens when users navigate around the platform. After a few navigations the scroll performance declines to a heavy stutter.
The profiler shows long running tasks that are ~95% "System" (see attached profiler screenshot). I also ran the tracer, but could not see any obvious problems apart from a lot of dropped frames (tracer output attached aswell). It looks as if a lot of time is spent in garbage collection. The memory footprint of our platform (and angular itself) is rather big, which makes it impossible to constuct a minimal working example.
After checking older versions of our own application, we could confirm that this issue is not happening on our side. it is also not affecting firefox. so we bisected chromium builds and could confirm that this issue is a regression: ``` You are probably looking for a change made after 1259542 (known good), but no later than 1259617 (first known bad). CHANGELOG URL: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/fe54bb24e2ce23c2a8b4f4f87cf578862301c7bc..2046f875062c4b2ccdaf16a2c13d0e138e3e6118 ```
# Summary Scrolling performance declined in memory heavy web application
# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: sensorservice crash
entry.content:
Hi Google Team,
When a certain headset is connected to a mobile phone, it will cause sensorservice crash. Is there any logic needed to avoid such problems?
Currently, three mobile phones have been tested, and all crashes occur.

entry.title: Add setting to completely hide the status bar on desktop
entry.content: Safari has for years had an option to completely hide the status bar that shows up on navigation. It is even shipping as hidden by default for some time now. This makes the browsing experience noticeably more distraction free with no "blinking" status bar showing up in the lower left corner. Most users don't even bother looking at its contents and it's not really a reliable security mechanism either (also see: it's not present on mobile anymore as well). Can we on desktop expose a toggle to the user to be able to completely hide it? Even if as a menu bar item only (as Safari does)?

entry.title: Clicking on F12 "Network" object "Response" before fully downloaded results in an error message
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Access a web page that downloads a JSON object which takes 20+ seconds to finish 2. Press F12 / Click on "Network" tab / Click on the "name" of downloading object / Click on "Response tab" Expectation is to see download object -- instead see an error message
# Problem Description Chrome recently introduced a bug when trying to view network responses before they are fully downloaded. Previously, clicking on "Response" to see the downloaded object would wait until the object was fully downloaded and then display the response. But recently there must have been a change, because now I will see a response only if the object is already fully downloaded. However, if I click on "Response" and the network object is still downloading, I will only see an error message "Failed to load response data: Request with the provided ID has already finished loading" -- and that error message remains even after the network object finishes downloading.
# Summary Clicking on F12 "Network" object "Response" before fully downloaded results in an error message
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: The data: URI of img src shows up in the PerformanceResourceTiming.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Having an audio element in the page ```

Heading

paragraph.

``` 2. Open dev tools console, list the performance entry resources ``` function perfObserver(list, observer) { list.getEntries().forEach((entry) => { console.log(`${entry.name}`); }); } const observer = new PerformanceObserver(perfObserver); observer.observe({ type: 'resource', buffered: true }) ``` 3. See the icons of the audio element are included as performance entries # Problem Description The data: URI of img src should not be included in the PerformanceResourceTiming according to https://www.w3.org/TR/resource-timing/. We found cases when there is a player in the page, the icons of the player (not the audio source) would be included. # Summary The data: URI of img src shows up in the PerformanceResourceTiming. # Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>PerformanceAPIs #### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem # Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: No MRU tab order available, even though other chromium browsers like opera do implement it.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. open multiple tabs 2. use ctrl-tab to navigate between tabs 3. the tab order is random or some other obscure distribution
# Problem Description Navigating through tens of open tabs is a chore, but a way to alleviate this is by having a way to cycle through tabs via a most recently used list. There are some extensions that tried to fix this but none really work, which makes me suspect there is some implementation issue.
P.S. I am willing to work myself on this feature, PM me :)
# Summary No MRU tab order available, even though other chromium browsers like opera do implement it.
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: File upload stop working when there's a New Chrome version notification
entry.content:
File upload stop working when there's a New Chrome version notification showing on the right top corner.
This issue has been reported repeatedly by developers in a developer community in China, and some mention this issue is there for years - MacOS.
Repro:
1. Wait until "New Chrome version notification" show up on the top right corner 2. Open this page: https://ant.design/components/upload-cn 3. Click on file upload, upload will fail

entry.title: In WebGL GLSL, applying fract directly to the result of texelFetch can produce the wrong result.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Go to this Shadertoy: https://www.shadertoy.com/view/4cGGWw, which reads a pixel using texelFetch from a texture with all values 2048.5 and applies fract directly to it. 2. An all-white screen indicates a problem (fract is returning 0.0 for pixel values of 2048.5)
# Problem Description As above. Changing code to read the pixel value into a float variable and doing fract on that produces the right answer, so I'm guessing that the compiler has erroneously used a 16-bit fract rather than 32-bit.
# Summary In WebGL GLSL, applying fract directly to the result of texelFetch can produce the wrong result.
# Custom Questions #### Example URL: https://www.shadertoy.com/view/4cGGWw
#### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Not sure - I don't know
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chromium problem
# Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: When Chrome requires an update due to a new version, the input file function will become disabled.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem When Chrome requires an update due to a new version, the input file function will become disabled. Clicking on "upload" will not elicit any response from the browser, and users must restart the browser to complete the update before being able to use it normally.
Visit this website or any page where file upload is required: https://ant.design/components/upload-cn Wait for Chrome browser to prompt for an update. Click on the file upload button on the page. At this point, the file selection dialog will not appear. Restart the browser once the update is complete. After restarting, file uploads should work as usual.
# Problem Description When Chrome requires an update due to a new version, the input file function will become disabled. Clicking on "upload" will not elicit any response from the browser, and users must restart the browser to complete the update before being able to use it normally.
# Summary When Chrome requires an update due to a new version, the input file function will become disabled.
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug - Software not working correctly
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A
